intro: Waltheria marielleae, commonly known as the Marielle's spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
